<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">APPLE HOSPITALITY REIT, INC.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000">TO BE HELD ON THURSDAY</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">,</font>&#160;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">MAY 18, <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">2017</font></font></div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The Annual Meeting of Shareholders (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;) of Apple Hospitality REIT, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) will be held at the Courtyard and Residence Inn Richmond Downtown, located at 1320 East Cary Street, Richmond, Virginia 23219, on Thursday</font>,<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000"> May 18, 2017 at 11:00 a.m., eastern daylight time, for the following purposes:</font></div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company is furnishing its proxy statement, proxy and 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders (the &#8220;Annual Report&#8221;) to you electronically via the Internet, instead of mailing printed copies of those materials to each shareholder. The Company has sent to its shareholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials that provides instructions on how to access its proxy materials on the Internet, how you can request and receive a paper copy of the proxy statement, Annual Report and proxy for the Annual Meeting and future meetings of shareholders and how to vote online at www.proxyvote.com. Shareholders can also call 1-800-579-1639 to request proxy materials or 1-800-690-6903 to vote by telephone. Additionally, this proxy statement and the Annual Report are available at http://materials.proxyvote.com/03784Y. Please read the enclosed information carefully before submitting your proxy.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">If you were a holder of record of any common shares of the Company at the close of business on the record date of March 24, 2017, you are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;If you are present at the meeting, you may vote in person even if you have previously returned a proxy card.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Regardless of the number of shares you hold, as a shareholder your role is very important, and the Board strongly encourages you to exercise your right to vote. </div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">If you have any questions or need assistance in voting your shares, please call Ms. Kelly Clarke in the Company&#8217;s Investor Relations Department, at (804) 344-8121.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">WHETHER OR NOT YOU EXPECT TO BE PRESENT AT THE MEETING, PLEASE VOTE ONLINE, BY PHONE OR BY SIGNING, DATING AND RETURNING THE PROXY CARD.&#160;&#160;IF YOU ATTEND THE MEETING, YOU MAY WITHDRAW YOUR PROXY AND VOTE IN PERSON.</font>&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">DATED</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">APRIL&#160;5, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Annual Meeting of Shareholders</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">to be Held</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">May 18, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">General</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The enclosed proxy is solicited by the Board of Directors of Apple Hospitality REIT, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) for the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held at the Courtyard and Residence Inn Richmond Downtown, located at 1320 East Cary Street, Richmond, Virginia 23219, on Thursday, May 18, 2017<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>at 11:00 a.m., eastern daylight time<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>(the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;). Your proxy may be revoked at any time before being voted at the Annual Meeting, either by a written notice of revocation that is received by the Company before the Annual Meeting or by conduct that is inconsistent with the continued effectiveness of the proxy, such as delivering another proxy with a later date or attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Unless your proxy indicates otherwise, all shares represented by a proxy that you sign and return will be voted <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FOR</font> the nominees listed in proposal 1, <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FOR</font> proposals 2, 4, 5.A, 5.B, 5.C and 5.D, for the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">1</font>&#160;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">YEAR</font> option in proposal 3, and in accordance with the best judgment of the proxy holders for any other matters properly brought before the Annual Meeting.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Record holders of the Company&#8217;s common shares (the &#8220;Common Shares&#8221;) at the close of business on March 24, 2017 (the &#8220;Record Date&#8221;) are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting.&#160; This proxy statement, the Company&#8217;s 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders, which includes the Company&#8217;s audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 (the &#8220;Annual Report&#8221;), and the proxy card are first being made available, and a </font>notice and electronic delivery of the proxy materials (the &#8220;Notice of Internet Availability&#8221;) <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">is first being mailed, to shareholders on or about April 5, 2017.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">As permitted by the rules of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221; or &#8220;Securities and Exchange Commission&#8221;), the Company is making this proxy statement and its Annual Report available to its shareholders electronically via the Internet. The Company believes that this process expedites receipt of its proxy materials by shareholders, while lowering the costs and reducing the environmental impact of the Annual Meeting. If you received the Notice of Internet Availability by mail, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials in the mail. Instead, the Notice of Internet Availability instructs you on how to access and review all of the important information contained in the proxy statement and Annual Report. The Notice of Internet Availability also instructs you on how you may submit your proxy over the Internet. If you received a Notice of Internet Availability by mail and would like to receive a printed copy of the proxy materials, please follow the instructions for requesting printed materials contained in the Notice of Internet Availability. &#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">At the close of business on the Record Date, a total of&#160;223,049,990 Common Shares were issued and outstanding and entitled to vote on all matters, including those to be acted upon at the Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;Each Common Share is entitled to one vote.&#160;&#160;The presence in person or by proxy of a majority of the Common Shares entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting will constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In the event that a quorum is not present at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders, it is expected the meeting will be adjourned or postponed to solicit additional proxies.</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">1</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Solicitation of Proxies</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company will be responsible for the costs of the solicitation set forth in this proxy statement. Brokerage houses, fiduciaries, nominees and others will be reimbursed for their out-of-pocket expenses in forwarding proxy materials to beneficial owners of Common Shares.&#160;&#160;In addition to soliciting proxies by mail, certain of the Company&#8217;s directors, officers and employees may solicit proxies by telephone, personal contact, or other means of communication.&#160;No additional compensation, except for reimbursement of reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, will be paid to directors, officers and employees of the Company in connection with the solicitation.&#160; Any questions or requests for assistance regarding this proxy solicitation may be directed to the Company by telephone at (804) 344-8121, Attention: Investor Relations, or your bank, broker or other custodian that holds your shares.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Company Information</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company operates as a real estate investment trust (&#8220;REIT&#8221;) for federal income tax purposes.&#160;&#160;The mailing address of the Company is 814 East Main Street, Richmond, Virginia 23219.&#160;&#160;Notice of revocation of proxies should be sent to Broadridge Financial Services, Inc., 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, New York 11717, Attn: Issuer Services Department.&#160;&#160;The Company can be contacted, and public information about the Company can be obtained, by sending a written notice to Ms. Kelly Clarke, Investor Relations Department, at the Company&#8217;s address as provided above or through its website www.applehospitalityreit.com.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The Annual Report provided with this proxy statement includes the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the year ended December 31, 2016 (except for exhibits).&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K and its other public federal securities filings also may be obtained electronically through the EDGAR system of the Securities and Exchange Commission at www.sec.gov.&#160;&#160;The proxy materials are available at </font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">http://materials.proxyvote.com/03784Y</font>.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Recent Changes in the Company&#8217;s Shareholder Base</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">On September 1, 2016, </font>the Company completed the merger with Apple REIT Ten, Inc., a real estate investment trust (&#8220;Apple Ten&#8221;), pursuant to which Apple Ten merged with and into 34 Consolidated, Inc., a Virginia corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company.&#160; As a result of the merger, the Company acquired the business of Apple Ten, which immediately prior to the effective time of the merger, owned 56 hotels located in 17 states with an aggregate of 7,209 rooms.&#160; The Company issued approximately 48.7 million Common Shares to former Apple Ten shareholders in the merger.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Ownership of Equity Securities</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The determination of &#8220;beneficial ownership&#8221; for purposes of this proxy statement has been based on information reported to the Company and the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160;&#160;References below to &#8220;beneficial ownership&#8221; by a particular person, and similar references, should not be construed as an admission or determination by the Company that Common Shares in fact are beneficially owned by such person.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">On the Record Date, the Company had a total of 223,049,990&#160;issued and outstanding Common Shares.&#160;&#160;Unless otherwise indicated, the address of each named person is c/o Apple Hospitality REIT, Inc., 814 East Main Street, Richmond, Virginia&#160; 23219.&#160; The following table sets forth the beneficial ownership of the Company&#8217;s securities by its directors, named executive officers and directors and executive officers as a group as of the Record Date:</div>

<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">4</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Proposal 1. Election of Directors</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company&#8217;s Board of Directors currently consists of seven directors who are divided into three classes with staggered terms.&#160;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">At the Annual Meeting, three (3) directors will be elected. </font>As part of Proposal 5, the Company is proposing an amendment to the Company&#8217;s articles of incorporation, as amended (the &#8220;Charter&#8221;), to declassify the Board and provide for the annual election of directors. See &#8220;Proposal 5&#8212;Approval and Adoption of Amended and Restated Articles of Incorporation&#8221; for additional information regarding the amendments to the Charter to declassify the Board.&#160; If Proposal 5.A is approved, the term of office of each director elected at the Annual Meeting will expire at the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders and if Proposal 5.A is not approved, the term of office of each director elected at the Annual Meeting will expire at the 2020 annual meeting of shareholders, and in each case, until a successor is duly elected and qualified, except in the event of prior resignation, death or removal.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The terms of Glenn W. Bunting, Glade M. Knight, and Daryl A. Nickel will expire at the time of the Annual Meeting and the Board of Directors recommends <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">their</font> re-election to the Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Unless otherwise specified, all Common Shares represented by proxies will be voted <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FOR</font> the election of the nominees listed.&#160;&#160;If a nominee ceases to be available for election as a director, discretionary authority may be exercised by each of the proxies named on the attached proxy card to vote for a substitute.&#160;&#160;No circumstances are presently known that would cause any nominee to be unavailable for election as a director.&#160;&#160;The nominees are now members of the Board of Directors, have been nominated by action of the Board of Directors, and have indicated their willingness to serve if elected.&#160;&#160;If a quorum is present at the Annual Meeting, three positions on the Board of Directors will be filled by the election of the three properly nominated candidates who receive the greatest number of votes at the Annual Meeting, even if the nominee does not receive a majority of all votes represented and entitled to be cast.&#160; Under the Company&#8217;s Corporate Governance Guidelines, if an incumbent director fails to receive at least a majority of the votes cast, such director will tender his or her resignation from the Board of Directors. The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee of the Board will consider, and determine whether to accept, such resignation and make a recommendation to the Board of Directors.&#160; Within 90 days of the certification of the election results, the Board of Directors must act on the resignation, taking into consideration any recommendation by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and any additional relevant factors.&#160; A director who tenders his or her resignation does not participate in the decisions of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee or the Board relating to the resignation.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">A shareholder who wishes to abstain from voting on the election of a director may do so by specifying, as provided on the proxy, that authority to vote for any or all of the nominees is to be withheld.&#160;&#160;Withheld votes and broker non-votes will have no effect on the election of a director.&#160; A broker non-vote occurs when the entity holding shares in street name has not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner and either chooses not to vote those shares on a routine matter at the shareholders meeting or is not permitted to vote those shares on a non-routine matter.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Nominees</font>. Below are brief descriptions of the nominees and their principal occupations and employment during at least the past five years and their directorships, if any, in public companies other than the Company.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Glenn W. Bunting</font>.&#160;&#160;Mr. Bunting, 72, has served as President of GB Corporation since January 2011.&#160;&#160;From 1985 until 2010, Mr. Bunting served as President of American KB Properties, Inc., which developed and managed shopping centers.&#160;&#160;Mr. Bunting was a director of Cornerstone Realty Income Trust, Inc. of which Glade M. Knight was Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, from 1993 until its merger with Colonial Properties Trust in 2005.&#160;&#160;He also served as a member of the Board of Directors of Landmark Apartment Trust, Inc.&#160;until 2016 when it merged with and into an affiliate of Starwood Capital Group.&#160;&#160;Mr. Bunting served as a director of Apple Hospitality Two, Inc. (&#8220;Apple Two&#8221;) and Apple Hospitality Five, Inc. (&#8220;Apple Five&#8221;) until the companies were sold in May 2007 </div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">5</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">and October 2007, respectively.&#160;&#160;Mr. Bunting also served as a director of Apple REIT Seven, Inc. (&#8220;Apple Seven&#8221;)<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff"> and </font>Apple REIT Eight, Inc. (&#8220;Apple Eight&#8221;) from 2006 and 2007, respectively, until their mergers with the Company (the &#8220;Apple Seven and Eight mergers&#8221;) were completed in March 2014.&#160;Apple Two, Apple Five, Apple Seven and Apple Eight were real estate investment trusts.&#160;&#160;Mr. Bunting has been a member of the Company&#8217;s Board and the Company&#8217;s Executive Committee and has served as the Chair of the Company&#8217;s Compensation Committee since March 1, 2014 and a member of the Company&#8217;s Audit Committee since January 1, 2015.&#160;Mr. Bunting received a bachelor&#8217;s degree in business administration from Campbell University.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>The <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">Board of Directors </font>believes his extensive management and REIT experience and strong background in commercial real estate and finance provide him with the skills and qualifications to serve as a director.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Glade M. Knight</font>.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight, 73, is the founder of and has served as Executive Chairman of the Company since May 15, 2014, and previously served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Company since its inception.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight was also the founder of Apple Ten and served as its Chairman and Chief Executive Officer from its inception until its merger with the Company in September 2016.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight was also the founder of Apple Seven and Apple Eight and served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of those companies from their inception until the Apple Seven and Eight mergers were completed in March 2014.&#160;&#160;In addition, Mr. Knight was the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Apple REIT Six, Inc. (&#8220;Apple Six&#8221;), a real estate investment trust, from 2004 until the company merged with an affiliate of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VII in May 2013.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight served in the same capacity for Apple Five from 2002 until the company was sold to Inland American Real Estate Trust, Inc. in October 2007, and Apple Two from 2001 until it was sold to an affiliate of ING Clarion in May 2007.&#160;&#160;In addition, Mr. Knight served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Cornerstone Realty Income Trust, Inc., a real estate investment trust, from 1993 until it merged with a subsidiary of Colonial Properties Trust in 2005.&#160;&#160;Following the merger in 2005 until April 2011, Mr. Knight served as a trustee of Colonial Properties Trust.&#160;&#160;Cornerstone Realty Income Trust, Inc. owned and operated apartment communities in Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia and Texas.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight is a partner and Chief Executive Officer of Energy 11 GP, LLC, the general partner of Energy 11, L.P., and Energy Resources 12 GP, LLC, the general partner of Energy Resources 12, L.P., partnerships focused on investments in the oil and gas industry. Mr. Knight is the founding Chairman of Southern Virginia University in Buena Vista, Virginia.&#160;&#160;He also is a member of the Advisory Board to the Graduate School of Real Estate and Urban Land Development at Virginia Commonwealth University.&#160;&#160;Additionally, he serves on the National Advisory Council for Brigham Young University and is a founding member of the University&#8217;s Entrepreneurial Department of the Graduate School of Business Management.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight has been a member of the Company&#8217;s Board and has served as the Chair of the Company&#8217;s Executive Committee since 2007.&#160;&#160;The Board of Directors believes his extensive REIT executive experience and extensive background in real estate, corporate finance and strategic planning, as well as his entrepreneurial background, provide him with the skills and qualifications to serve as a director.&#160;&#160;On February 12, 2014, Mr. Knight, Apple Seven, Apple Eight, Apple REIT Nine, Inc. (&#8220;Apple Nine&#8221;) and their related advisory companies entered into settlement agreements with the SEC.&#160;&#160;Along with Apple Seven, Apple Eight, Apple Nine and their advisory companies, and without admitting or denying the SEC&#8217;s allegations, Mr. Knight consented to the entry of an administrative order, under which Mr. Knight and the noted companies each agreed to cease and desist from committing or causing any violations of Sections 13(a), 13(b)(2)(A), 13(b)(2)(B), 14(a), and 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;) and Rules 12b-20, 13a-1, 13a-13, 13a-14, 14a-9, and 16a-3 thereunder.</div>

<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Glade M. Knight is the father of Justin G. Knight, the Company&#8217;s President and Chief Executive Officer, and Nelson G. Knight, the Company&#8217;s Executive Vice President and Chief Investment Officer.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">

Nickel</font>. Mr. Nickel, 72, completed a 22-year career at Marriott International, Inc., an international hospitality company, in 2009. He served as a corporate officer of Marriott International from 1998 until his retirement and as Executive Vice President, Lodging Development, Select Service and Extended Stay Brands from 2001. Since 2011, Mr. Nickel also has served as a consultant </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">to White Peterman Properties, Inc., a hotel development company. Mr. Nickel graduated from Georgetown Law School and earned his bachelor&#8217;s degree from Washburn University. Between college and law school, Mr. Nickel served in the U.S. Navy. Hugh Redd</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">. He had worked for General Dynamics Corporation since 1986, serving as a Senior Financial Analyst and also as Vice President and Controller of General Dynamics Land Systems in Sterling Heights, Michigan. Mr. Redd currently serves on the Board of Trustees for Southern Virginia University in Buena Vista, Virginia. The Board of Directors believes his extensive financial and accounting experience, as well as his management experience in public companies, provide him with the skills and qualifications to serve as a director.</font>&#160;</div>

Knight</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">. Mr. Knight joined the Apple REIT companies in 2000. Mr. Knight currently serves on the Board of Trustees for Southern Virginia University in Buena Vista, Virginia. Mr. Knight is also a member of the National Advisory Council of the Marriott School at Brigham Young University, Provo, Utah.&#160; Mr. Knight holds a Master of Business Administration degree with an emphasis in Corporate Strategy and Finance from the Marriott School at Brigham Young University. Knight, the Company&#8217;s Executive Chairman, and the brother of Nelson G. Knight, the Company&#8217;s Executive Vice President and Chief Investment Officer.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">8</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Proposal 2. Advisory Vote On Executive Compensation Paid by the Company</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, enacted in July 2010, requires that the Company provide its shareholders with the opportunity to vote to approve, on a non-binding, advisory basis, the compensation paid to the Company&#8217;s named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement.&#160;&#160;The Company encourages shareholders to read the disclosure under &#8220;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#8221; for more information concerning the Company&#8217;s compensation philosophy, programs and practices, the compensation and governance-related actions taken in fiscal 2016 and the compensation paid to the named executive officers. The Board of Directors has adopted a policy that provides for an annual shareholder advisory vote on the executive compensation paid by the Company; however, at the Annual Meeting shareholders will have the opportunity to vote, on a non-binding advisory basis, on how often this vote will be held in the future, as set forth in Proposal 3.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">As required by Section 14A of the Exchange Act, the Company is asking you to vote on the adoption of the following resolution:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">RESOLVED: That the shareholders of the Company approve, on a nonbinding, advisory basis, the compensation paid to the Company&#8217;s named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and narrative discussion in the proxy statement.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast will be necessary to approve this proposal.&#160;&#160;Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of this proposal.&#160;&#160;The shareholder vote on this proposal is advisory and nonbinding and serves only as a recommendation to the Board of Directors.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE &#8220;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><u>FOR</u></font>&#8221; THE ABOVE PROPOSAL.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">9</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Proposal 3. Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Executive Compensation Vote</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 19.85pt">As described in Proposal 2 above, the Company&#8217;s shareholders are being provided the opportunity to approve, on a non-binding, advisory basis, the compensation paid to the Company&#8217;s named executive officers. The advisory vote on executive compensation described in Proposal 2 above is referred to as a &#8220;say-on-pay vote.&#8221;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 19.85pt">This Proposal 3 affords shareholders the opportunity to cast a non-binding, advisory vote on how often the Company should include a say-on-pay vote in its proxy materials for future annual shareholder meetings (or special shareholder meeting for which the Company must include executive compensation information in the proxy statement for that meeting). Under this Proposal 3, shareholders may vote to have the say-on-pay vote every year, every two years or every three years. Shareholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the Board of Director&#8217;s recommendation. The shareholder vote on this proposal is advisory and non-binding, and serves only as a recommendation to the Board of Directors.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 19.85pt">The Company believes that say-on-pay votes should be conducted every year so that shareholders may annually express their views on the Company&#8217;s executive compensation program. The Company values the opinions expressed by shareholders in these votes and will continue to consider the outcome of these votes in making its decisions on executive compensation.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 19.85pt">This advisory vote will be adopted for state law purposes if the votes for one of the three options exceed the votes cast for the other two options combined. However, the Company will consider shareholders to have expressed a non-binding preference for the frequency option that receives the most favorable votes. Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of this proposal.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS</font> RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR A FREQUENCY OF<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><br>
</font>&#8220;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><u>1 YEAR</u></font>&#8221; FOR THE ABOVE PROPOSAL.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">10</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Proposal 4. Ratification of the Appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as the Company&#8217;s Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The firm of Ernst &amp; Young LLP served as the independent registered public accounting firm for the Company in 2016.&#160;&#160;A representative of Ernst &amp; Young LLP is expected to be present at the Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;The representative will have an opportunity to make a statement if he or she so desires and will be available to answer appropriate questions from shareholders.&#160;&#160;The Board of Directors has approved the retention of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for 2017, based on the recommendation of the Audit Committee.&#160; Independent accounting fees for the last two fiscal years are shown in the table below:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">All services rendered by Ernst &amp; Young LLP are permissible under applicable laws and regulations, and the annual audit of the Company was pre-approved by the Audit Committee, as required by applicable law.&#160;&#160;The nature of each of the services categorized in the preceding table is described below:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Audit Fees</font>. These are fees for professional services rendered for the audit of the Company&#8217;s annual financial statements included in the Company&#8217;s Form 10-K, reviews of the financial statements included in the Company&#8217;s Form 10-Q filings, or services normally provided by the independent auditor in connection with statutory or regulatory filings or engagements, and other accounting and financial reporting work necessary to comply with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (&#8220;PCAOB&#8221;) and fees for services that only the Company&#8217;s independent auditor can reasonably provide.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Audit-Related Fees</font>.&#160;&#160;These are fees for assurance and related services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of the Company&#8217;s financial statements.&#160;&#160;Such services include accounting consultations, internal control reviews, audits in connection with acquisitions, attest services related to financial reporting that are not required by statute or regulation and required agreed-upon procedure engagements.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Tax Fees</font>.&#160;&#160;Such services include tax compliance, tax advice and tax planning.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">All Other Fees</font>.&#160;&#160;These are fees for other permissible work that does not meet the above category descriptions.&#160;&#160;Such services include information technology and technical assistance provided to the Company.&#160;&#160;Generally, this category would include permitted corporate finance assistance, advisory services and licenses to technical accounting research software.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">These accounting services are actively monitored (as to both spending level and work content) by the Audit Committee to maintain the appropriate objectivity and independence in the core area of accounting work by Ernst &amp; Young LLP, which is the audit of the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pre-Approval Policy for Audit and Non-Audit Services</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">.&#160;&#160;In accordance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, all audit and non-audit services provided to the Company by its independent auditors must be pre-approved by the Audit Committee.&#160;&#160;As authorized by that act, the Audit Committee has delegated to the Chair of the Audit Committee the authority to pre-approve up to $25,000 in audit and non-audit services.&#160;&#160;This authority may be exercised when the Audit Committee is not in session.&#160;&#160;Any decisions by the Chair of the Audit Committee under this delegated authority will be reported at the next meeting of the Audit Committee.&#160;&#160;All services reported in the preceding fee table for fiscal years 2015 and 2016 were pre-approved by the full Audit Committee, as required by then applicable law.</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">11</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company is asking you to vote on the adoption of the following resolution:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">RESOLVED: That the shareholders of the Company ratify the appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast will be necessary to approve this proposal.&#160;&#160;Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of this proposal.&#160;&#160;The shareholder vote on this proposal is advisory and non-binding and serves only as a recommendation to the Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;If the shareholders do not ratify the appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP by the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the meeting, the Audit Committee will reconsider whether or not to retain Ernst &amp; Young LLP.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE &#8220;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><u>FOR</u></font>&#8221; THE ABOVE PROPOSAL.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
 &#160;</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">12</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Proposal 5. Approval and Adoption of Amended and Restated Articles of Incorporation</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Board of Directors, in its continuing review of corporate governance matters, and after careful consideration, has concluded that it is in the best interests of the Company&#8217;s shareholders to amend and restate the Charter, to (1) declassify the Board of Directors, (2) require a majority vote for all amendments to the Charter, (3) eliminate certain supermajority voting default rules for affiliated transactions and (4) remove certain provisions that are no longer applicable, as more fully described below. The overall goal of these amendments is to enhance the rights of shareholders, improve the Company&#8217;s corporate governance and simplify the Charter.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">These amendments were previously submitted to shareholders for approval at the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders.&#160; However, none of the amendments received the requisite shareholder vote necessary to approve and adopt the amendments.&#160; The Board of Directors is re-submitting these amendments because, for the reasons discussed below, the Board continues to believe that these amendments are advisable and in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The proposed Charter amendments are being submitted for approval through four separate proposals&#8212;Proposal 5.A, Proposal 5.B, Proposal 5.C and Proposal 5.D. Under the Company&#8217;s current Charter, the proposed amendment included in Proposal 5.A must be approved by the affirmative vote of <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">more than two-thirds of the issued and outstanding Common Shares.&#160; The </font>proposed amendments included in Proposals 5.B and 5.D must be approved by the affirmative vote of <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">a majority of the issued and outstanding Common Shares. With respect to Proposal 5.C, under the </font>Virginia Stock Corporation Act (the &#8220;VSCA&#8221;)<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">, shares that are owned by interested shareholders (if any) are not entitled to vote with respect to this amendment.&#160; Therefore, the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares held by the shareholders of the Company (other than shares held by interested shareholders) is required to approve the proposed amendment in Proposal 5.C.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">A copy of the proposed Amended and Restated Articles of Incorporation (the &#8220;Amended and Restated Charter&#8221;) is attached to this proxy statement as <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><u>Exhibit&#160;A</u></font>, with deletions indicated by strikethroughs and additions indicated by underlining (with such marks against our existing Charter). In addition to effecting the proposed amendments to our existing Charter described above, the proposed Amended and Restated Charter would restate and integrate into a single document all prior amendments to the Company&#8217;s articles of incorporation, which was filed with the Virginia State Corporation Commission in November 2007 and became effective in April 2008.&#160; These prior amendments, which occurred in March 2014, include:</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div>
<table id="zf65669b4ef554e7cad97402f80d6302b" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="z50dde24d68a3448f9f8bcbaa2ba73141" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">

</td>

</td>
</tr>

</div>

<div>

<tr>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="z27ee5a616dd247f29049336cfd8daa3a" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
