<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Executive Officers</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In 2016, the Company&#8217;s executive officers were: Glade M. Knight, who served as Executive Chairman; Justin G. Knight (Glade M. Knight&#8217;s son), who served as President and Chief Executive Officer; Kristian M. Gathright, who served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer; Bryan F. Peery, who served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer; David P. Buckley, who served as Executive Vice President and Chief Legal Officer; and Nelson G. Knight (Glade M. Knight&#8217;s son), who served as Executive Vice President and Chief Investment Officer.&#160;&#160;Each executive officer is appointed annually by the Board of Directors at its meeting prior to the annual meeting of shareholders.&#160; The biographies of Glade M. Knight and Justin G. Knight are provided above in the section titled &#8220;Proposal 1. Election of Directors.&#8221;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">David P. Buckley</font>.&#160;&#160;Mr. Buckley, 49, has served as Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary&#160;for the Company since its inception.&#160;&#160;In addition, Mr. Buckley served as Executive Vice President and Chief Legal&#160;Counsel for Apple Ten from its inception until its merger with the Company in September 2016, and also served as Executive Vice President and Chief Legal Counsel for Apple Seven and Apple Eight from 2005 and 2007, respectively, until the Apple Seven and Eight mergers were completed in March 2014.&#160;&#160;Mr. Buckley served as Senior Vice President and General Counsel for Apple Two and Apple Five until Apple Two was sold to an affiliate of ING Clarion in May 2007 and Apple Five was sold to Inland American Real Estate Trust, Inc. in October 2007.&#160;&#160;Mr. Buckley also served as Executive Vice President and General Counsel of Apple Six from 2005 until Apple Six merged with an affiliate of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VII in May 2013.&#160;&#160;Prior to his service with these companies, from 1999 to 2005, Mr. Buckley served as an Associate, specializing in commercial real estate, with McGuireWoods, a full-service law firm headquartered in Richmond, Virginia.&#160;&#160;Mr. Buckley holds a Juris Doctor degree, Cum Laude, from the University of Richmond, Richmond, Virginia, a Master of Urban and Regional Planning degree from Virginia Commonwealth University, Richmond, Virginia, and a Bachelor of Science degree in Industrial Technology from the University of Massachusetts Lowell, Lowell, Massachusetts.&#160;&#160;Mr. Buckley is a member of the Virginia State Bar and the Richmond Bar Association.&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Kristian M. Gathright</font>.&#160;&#160;Mrs. Gathright, 44, has served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for the Company since its inception.&#160;&#160;In addition, Mrs. Gathright served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for Apple Ten from its inception until its merger with the Company in September 2016.&#160;&#160;She also served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer for Apple Seven and Apple Eight until the Apple Seven and Eight mergers were completed in March 2014.&#160;&#160;Mrs. Gathright served as Chief Operating Officer and Senior Vice President of Operations for Apple Two until it was sold to an affiliate of ING Clarion in May 2007.&#160;&#160;Mrs. Gathright also served as Senior Vice President of Operations for Apple Five until it was sold to Inland American Real Estate Trust, Inc. in October 2007.&#160;&#160;She served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of Apple Six until it merged with an affiliate of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VII in May 2013. Prior to managing these companies, Mrs. Gathright served as Assistant Vice President and Investor Relations Manager for Cornerstone Realty Income Trust, Inc.,&#160;a REIT that owned and operated apartment communities in Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia and Texas.&#160;&#160;From 1996 to 1998, she was an Asset Manager and Regional Controller of the Northern Region Operations for United Dominion Realty Trust, Inc., a real estate investment trust. From 1994 to 1996, she served as a Senior Staff Accountant at Ernst &amp; Young LLP.&#160;&#160;Mrs. Gathright serves as President of the Courtyard Franchise Advisory Council and on the Consumer Innovation Forum of the American Hotel and Lodging Association.&#160;&#160;Mrs. Gathright holds a Bachelor of Science degree, Graduate with Distinction, in Accounting from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Virginia.&#160;&#160;Mrs. Gathright passed the Virginia CPA Exam in 1994.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Nelson G. Knight</font>. Mr. Knight, 35, has served as Executive Vice President and Chief Investment Officer for the Company since May 2014.&#160; Prior to this position, he served as the Senior Vice President of Development for the Company from 2009.&#160;&#160;He served as Senior Vice President of Development for Apple Ten from its inception until its merger with the Company in September 2016.&#160;&#160;</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">24</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">He also served in the same capacity for Apple Six (until its sale in 2013), and Apple Seven and Apple Eight (until the Apple Seven and Eight mergers were completed in March 2014).&#160;&#160;He served as Vice President of Acquisitions and Capital Markets until 2009 for the Company, Apple Two (until its sale in 2007), Apple Five (until its sale in 2007), Apple Six, Apple Seven and Apple Eight. Mr. Knight serves on the Home2 Suites Owner Advisory Committee, the TownePlace Suites Franchise Advisory Council, as an advisory member of the Hunter Hotels Investment Conference and chairs the TownePlace Suites System Marketing Committee.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight also currently serves on the National Advisory Council for Southern Virginia University in Buena Vista, Virginia and the Alumni Executive Board for the Neeley School of Business at Texas Christian University.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight holds a Master of Business Administration from Texas Christian University, as well as a Bachelor of Arts Degree, Cum Laude, in History with a minor in Business from Southern Virginia University in Buena Vista, Virginia.</div>

<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Nelson G. Knight is the son of Glade M. Knight, the Company&#8217;s Executive Chairman, and the brother of Justin G. Knight, the Company&#8217;s President and Chief Executive Officer.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Bryan F. Peery</font>.&#160;&#160;Mr. Peery, 52, has served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer for the Company since its inception.&#160;&#160;He served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer for Apple Ten from its inception until its merger with the Company in September 2016.&#160;&#160;In addition, Mr. Peery served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer for Apple Seven and Apple Eight, until the Apple Seven and Eight mergers were completed in March 2014.&#160;&#160;Mr. Peery also served as Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer for Apple Two and Apple Five until Apple Two was sold to an affiliate of ING Clarion in May 2007 and Apple Five was sold to Inland American Real Estate Trust, Inc. in October 2007.&#160;&#160;He also served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer for Apple Six until it merged with an affiliate of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VII in May 2013.&#160;&#160;Prior to his service with these companies, Mr. Peery served as President (2000-2003), Vice President-Finance (1998-2000) and Controller (1997-1998) of This End Up Furniture Company.&#160;&#160;Mr. Peery was with Owens &amp; Minor, Inc., a medical and surgical supplies distributor, from 1991 until 1997, where he last served as Director and Assistant Controller-Financial Reporting.&#160;&#160;Mr. Peery&#8217;s experience also includes five years of service with KPMG LLP.&#160;&#160;Mr. Peery holds a Bachelor of Business Administration degree in Accounting from the College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Virginia.&#160;&#160;Mr. Peery is a Certified Public Accountant.&#160;On February 12, 2014, Mr. Peery, Apple Seven, Apple Eight, Apple Nine and their related advisory companies entered into settlement agreements with the SEC. Along with Apple Seven, Apple Eight, Apple Nine and their advisory companies, and without admitting or denying the SEC&#8217;s allegations, Mr. Peery consented to the entry of an administrative order, under which Mr. Peery and the noted companies each agreed to cease and desist from committing or causing any violations of Sections 13(a), 13(b)(2)(A), 13(b)(2)(B), 14(a), and 16(a) of the Exchange Act and Rules 12b-20, 13a-1, 13a-13, 13a-14, 14a-9, and 16a-3 thereunder.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">25</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Audit Committee Report</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors is currently composed of three directors.&#160;&#160;All three directors are independent directors as defined under &#8220;Committees of the Board and Board Leadership</font>&#8212;Audit Committee Independence<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">.&#8221;&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee operates under a written charter that was adopted by the Board of Directors and is annually reassessed and updated, as needed, in accordance with applicable rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee oversees the Company&#8217;s financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;In fulfilling its oversight duties, the Committee reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements for fiscal year 2016 with management and the Company&#8217;s independent auditors, Ernst &amp; Young LLP, including the quality and acceptability of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments and the clarity of disclosure in the financial statements.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee also reviewed management&#8217;s report on its assessment of the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting and Ernst &amp; Young LLP&#8217;s report on the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.&#160;&#160;Management is responsible for the preparation, presentation and integrity of the Company&#8217;s financial statements, accounting and financial reporting principles, internal controls, and procedures designed to assure compliance with accounting standards and applicable laws and regulations.&#160;&#160;Ernst &amp; Young LLP is responsible for performing an independent audit of the consolidated financial statements in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards.</font></div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Audit Committee also has discussed with the independent auditors the matters required to be discussed pursuant to PCAOB Auditing Standard No. AU 380, &#8220;Communication with Audit Committees.&#8221;&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Audit Committee has received the written disclosures and letter from the independent auditors required by PCAOB Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, &#8220;Communications with Audit Committees Concerning Independence,&#8221; and has discussed with the independent auditors, the independent auditors&#8217; independence.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Based on the review and discussions described in this Report, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Audit Committee Report above does not constitute &#8220;soliciting material&#8221; and will not be deemed &#8220;filed&#8221; or incorporated by reference into any of the Company&#8217;s filings under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, that might incorporate SEC filings by reference, in whole or in part, notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in those filings.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">26</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Certain Relationships and Agreements</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company has, and is expected to continue to engage in, transactions with related parties. These transactions cannot be construed to be at arm&#8217;s length and the results of the Company&#8217;s operations may be different if these transactions were conducted with non-related parties. The Company&#8217;s independent members of the Board of Directors oversee and annually review the Company&#8217;s related party relationships (including the relationships discussed in this section) and are required to approve any significant modifications to the existing relationships, as well as any new significant related party transactions. The Board of Directors is not required to approve each individual transaction that falls under the related party relationships. However, under the direction of the Board of Directors, at least one member of the Company&#8217;s senior management team approves each related party transaction.&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The term the &#8220;Apple REIT Entities&#8221; means the Company, Apple Seven, Apple Eight and Apple Ten.&#160;&#160;The term the &#8220;Advisors&#8221; means Apple Seven Advisors, Inc., Apple Eight Advisors, Inc., Apple Nine Advisors, Inc. (&#8220;A9A&#8221;), Apple Ten Advisors, Inc. (&#8220;A10A&#8221;) and Apple Realty Group, Inc. (&#8220;ARG&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Glade M. Knight, Executive Chairman of the Company and formerly Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, was Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Apple Ten (prior to the Apple Ten merger), and Apple Seven and Apple Eight (prior to the Apple Seven and Eight mergers).&#160; The Advisors are wholly-owned by Mr. Knight.&#160;&#160;Mr. Knight is also currently a partner and Chief Executive Officer of Energy 11 GP, LLC and Energy Resources 12 GP, LLC, which are the respective general partners of Energy 11, L.P. and&#160;Energy Resources&#160;12, L.P.&#160; Justin G. Knight, the Company&#8217;s President and Chief Executive Officer, and a member of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors, also served as President of Apple Ten (prior to the Apple Ten merger), and Apple Seven and Apple Eight (prior to the Apple Seven and Eight mergers).&#160;&#160;Prior to the Apple Seven and Eight mergers, members of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors were also on the Board of Directors of Apple Seven and/or Apple Eight.&#160;&#160;Mr. Glade M. Knight is the only member of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors that was also on the Board of Directors of Apple Ten.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Apple Seven and Apple Eight Mergers</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Pursuant to the Agreement and Plan of Merger entered into on August 7, 2013, as amended (the &#8220;Merger Agreement&#8221;), Apple Seven and Apple Eight merged with and into wholly-owned subsidiaries of the Company effective March 1, 2014 and Apple Seven&#8217;s and Apple Eight&#8217;s separate corporate existence ceased.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Prior to the Apple Seven and Eight mergers, the Company was externally managed and did not have any employees. Its advisor, A9A, provided the Company with its day-to-day management.&#160;&#160;ARG provided the Company with property acquisition and disposition services.&#160;&#160;The Company paid fees and reimbursed certain costs to A9A and ARG for these services. A9A provided the management services to the Company through an affiliate, Apple Fund Management, Inc. (&#8220;AFM&#8221;), a wholly-owned subsidiary of A9A prior to the Apple Seven and Eight mergers.&#160; Apple Seven and Apple Eight were also externally managed, and had similar arrangements with external advisors and AFM prior to the Apple Seven and Eight mergers.&#160;&#160;As contemplated in the Merger Agreement, in connection with the Apple Seven and Eight mergers effective March 1, 2014, the Company became self-advised and Apple Seven, Apple Eight and the Company terminated their advisory agreements with their respective Advisors, and AFM became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company.&#160;&#160;As a result, the employees, including management, are now employed by the Company rather than by the Company&#8217;s external advisor.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In connection with the Merger Agreement, on August 7, 2013, the Company entered into a subcontract agreement with A10A to subcontract A10A&#8217;s obligations under the advisory agreement between A10A and Apple Ten to the Company.&#160;&#160;From and after the Apple Seven and Eight mergers until September 1, 2016, the effective date of the merger of the Company and Apple Ten (the &#8220;A10 merger&#8221;), the Company provided to Apple Ten the advisory services contemplated under the A10A advisory agreement and the Company received an annual fee that ranged from 0.1% to 0.25% of </div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">27</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Apple Ten&#8217;s total equity contributions, depending on Apple Ten&#8217;s operating results. Total advisory fees earned by the Company from Apple Ten in 2016 totaled approximately $</font>1.6 million<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">. As a result of the termination of the subcontract agreement in connection with the completion of the A10 merger, Apple Ten no longer pays the various fees previously paid to the Company under the subcontract agreement and A10A no longer subcontracts its advisory services to the Company. Additionally, effective September 1, 2016, Apple Ten no longer had any advisory services contract.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Apple Ten Merger</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Pursuant to the Agreement and Plan of Merger entered into on April 13, 2016, as amended (the &#8220;A10 Merger Agreement&#8221;), Apple Ten merged with and into 34 Consolidated, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, effective September 1, 2016, and Apple Ten&#8217;s separate corporate existence ceased. As consideration in the A10 merger, the Company paid $93.6 million in cash, including cash in lieu of fractional Common Shares, and issued approximately 48.7 million Common Shares to shareholders of Apple Ten.&#160; Accordingly, in the A10 merger the executive officers of the Company received their proportionate interest of the newly issued Common Shares, and cash proceeds, which totaled 3.1 million Common Shares and $6.0 million in cash.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">As more fully described under &#8220;&#8212;Apple Seven and Apple Eight Mergers&#8221; above, prior to the A10 merger, the Company provided advisory services to Apple Ten pursuant to a subcontract agreement with A10A.&#160; Concurrently with the execution of the A10 Merger Agreement, the Company and Apple Ten entered into a termination agreement with A10A and ARG, each of which is owned by Glade M. Knight. Pursuant to the termination agreement, the existing advisory agreement, property acquisition/disposition agreement and subcontract agreement with respect to Apple Ten were terminated effective immediately after the effective time of the A10 merger on September 1, 2016.&#160; No fees were paid as a result of the termination of the existing advisory agreement, property acquisition/disposition agreement and subcontract agreement.&#160; After the A10 merger, the Company has continued and will continue to provide support services to ARG for activities unrelated to Apple Ten. See &#8220;&#8212;Apple REIT Entities and Advisors Cost Sharing Structure&#8221; below.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Apple REIT Entities and Advisors Cost Sharing Structure</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">After the Apple Seven and Eight mergers, effective March 1, 2014, the Company provided support services to Apple Ten and its advisors, A10A and ARG, which agreed to reimburse the Company for its costs in providing these services.&#160; After the A10 merger, the Company has continued to provide support services to ARG for activities unrelated to Apple Ten.&#160; Total reimbursed costs received by the Company from these entities for 2016 (including Apple Ten, A10A and ARG prior to September 1, 2016 and ARG thereafter) totaled approximately $2.5 million.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, total amounts due from ARG, for activities unrelated to Apple Ten, for reimbursements under the cost sharing structure totaled approximately $0.2 million.&#160; Under this cost sharing structure, amounts reimbursed to the Company include both compensation for personnel and office related costs (including office rent, utilities, office supplies, etc.) used by each company during these periods.&#160; The amounts reimbursed to the Company are based on the actual costs of the services and are not based on formal record keeping regarding the time these personnel devote to the company, but are based on a good faith estimate of the proportionate amount of time incurred by the Company&#8217;s employees on behalf of Apple Ten, A10A and ARG prior to the A10 merger, and ARG for activities unrelated to Apple Ten after the A10 merger.&#160; Effective September 1, 2016, as part of the cost sharing arrangement, certain day-to-day transactions may result in amounts due to or from the Company and ARG for activities unrelated to Apple Ten.&#160; To efficiently manage cash disbursements, the Company or ARG may make payments for the other company.&#160; Under this cash management process, each company may advance or defer up to $1 million at any time.&#160; Each quarter, any outstanding amounts are settled between the companies.&#160; This process allows each company to minimize its cash on hand and reduces the cost for each company.&#160; The amounts outstanding at any point in time are not significant to either of the companies.&#160; Prior to the A10 merger, Apple Ten, A10A and ARG (for activities both related and unrelated to Apple Ten) were part of the cost sharing structure and participated in this cash management process.</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">28</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Apple Air Holding, LLC Membership Interest; Aircraft Usage</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company, through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Apple Air Holding, LLC (&#8220;Apple Air&#8221;), owns a Learjet used primarily for acquisition, asset management, renovation and public relations purposes.&#160; The aircraft is also leased to affiliates of the Company based on third party rates.&#160; Prior to the A10 merger, Apple Air was jointly owned by the Company (74%) and Apple Ten (26%), with Apple Ten&#8217;s ownership interest accounted for as a minority interest. With the completion of the A10 merger, the Company acquired Apple Ten&#8217;s interest for a total allocated purchase price of approximately $0.7 million which approximated the fair market value of the interest.&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2016, revenue from affiliates was approximately $0.04 million, including revenue from Apple Ten prior to the A10 merger.&#160; The Company also utilizes aircraft, owned through two entities, one of which is owned by the Company&#8217;s Executive Chairman, and the other, by its President and Chief Executive Officer, for acquisition, asset management, renovation and public relations purposes, and reimburses these entities at third-party rates.&#160; Total costs incurred for use of these aircraft during 2016 were approximately $0.2 million.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">29</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Compensation Discussion and Analysis</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Introduction</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes the Company&#8217;s executive compensation arrangements for the Company&#8217;s named executive officers for 2016 and explains the structure and rationale associated with each material element of the 2016 compensation arrangements.&#160; The named executive officers for 2016 are as follows:</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 9pt">
<table id="z45735b2c931940bfb97bd0391dc66a1b" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">

</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Share Return Performance</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">During 2016, the Company continued to deliver strong cumulative total shareholder returns compared to key indices, as shown below. The graph assumes an initial investment of $100 in Common Shares and in each of the indices, and also assumes the reinvestment of dividends for the period from May 18, 2015, the date of the Listing, to December&#160;31, 2016.&#160;&#160;The SNL US REIT Hotel Index is comprised of publicly traded REITs which focus on investments in hotel properties.&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><img src="graph.jpg"></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: -9pt">
<hr style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; HEIGHT: 1px; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 0px; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; WIDTH: 12%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="left" noshade="noshade">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: -9pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">* </font>This performance graph shall not be deemed &#8220;filed&#8221; for the purposes of Section&#160;18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or incorporated by reference into any filing by the Company under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Securities Exchange Act, except as shall be expressly set forth by specific reference in such filing. The performance graph is not indicative of future investment performance.&#160;&#160;The Company does not make or endorse any predictions as to future share price performance.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">General Philosophy and Objectives</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company&#8217;s executive compensation philosophy continues to focus on attracting, motivating and retaining a superior management team that can maximize shareholder value. The compensation arrangements are designed to reward performance relative to financial and other metrics that the Company believes are key metrics that will enhance shareholder value and to reward executive </div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">30</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">officers for performance at levels that the Compensation Committee believes to be competitive with other public hospitality REITs.&#160; The compensation arrangements consist of both base salary and annual incentive compensation which is intended to incentivize executive officers to manage the Company in a prudent manner without encouraging unnecessary risk-taking.&#160; In establishing the compensation arrangements, the Compensation Committee believes the best way to maintain the alliance of management and shareholder objectives is to have a larger variable component tied to key metrics. The incentive goals in the annual incentive compensation program are set at competitive levels which require stretch performance but are believed to be achievable.&#160; As a result, approximately 80% of target compensation of the named executive officers is variable. The Compensation Committee also reviews and considers the management team&#8217;s overall compensation. The Company has not adopted a formal policy or guideline for allocating compensation between long-term and short-term compensation, between cash and non-cash compensation or among different forms of non-cash compensation.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Role of the Compensation Committee</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Pursuant to the Compensation Committee&#8217;s charter, the Compensation Committee assists the Board of Directors in discharging the Board of Director&#8217;s responsibilities relating to compensation of the Company&#8217;s officers. The Compensation Committee&#8217;s duties and responsibilities include, among other things, the following:</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
<div>
<table id="zc7ab22a1909d47fbafafdcf1e198cb0c" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left">annually review and approve corporate goals and objectives relevant to the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer, and after evaluating performance in light of those goals and objectives, approve compensation of the Chief Executive Officer;</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="ze9b7bf4e28aa4cdd93e9ef47450c3f38" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left">annually review corporate goals and objectives relevant to the compensation of the executive management officers of the Company, and after evaluating performance in light of those goals and objectives,&#160;approve compensation of executive management officers of the Company, other than the Chief Executive Officer; and</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="z2ce76f2d83c8458b8318fddde98ae39d" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left">review and make periodic recommendations to the Board of Directors with respect to the general compensation, benefits and perquisites policies and practices of the Company.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Compensation Committee&#8217;s charter permits it to delegate its functions to one or more subcommittees as permitted by law.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company&#8217;s current executive compensation structure was initially developed in 2014 by the Compensation Committee and has been reviewed and modified (as necessary) by the Compensation Committee each year thereafter.&#160; In reviewing the compensation structure, the Compensation Committee evaluated data regarding executive compensation paid by other public hospitality REITs and other peer group information provided by FPL Associates L.P. (&#8220;FPL&#8221;) in 2016.&#160; The Compensation Committee utilizes FPL&#8217;s recommendations in conjunction with market data to determine annual executive compensation.&#160; Compensation for 2016 for each named executive officer was approved by the Compensation Committee after consideration of each individual&#8217;s experience in their position and the industry, the risks and deterrents associated with their positions, the anticipated difficulty to replace the individual, and total compensation paid to each named executive officer in prior years.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Role of Chief Executive Officer</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In connection with determining compensation of executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer, the Compensation Committee may seek input from the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer.&#160; Any recommendations given by the Chief Executive Officer will be based upon the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s assessment of the Company&#8217;s overall performance, each executive officer&#8217;s individual performance and employee retention considerations.&#160; The Compensation Committee reviews the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s recommendations, and in its sole discretion determines all executive officer compensation. The Chief Executive Officer will not provide any recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding his or her own compensation.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">31</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Compensation Consultant</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In 2014, the Compensation Committee initially consulted with FPL as its independent executive compensation consultant regarding compensation arrangements for 2014 and 2015.&#160; The Compensation Committee&#8217;s charter authorizes the Compensation Committee to retain or obtain the advice of a compensation consultant to advise it in the evaluation of executive officer compensation. In connection with developing the executive compensation structure and making executive compensation decisions, the Compensation Committee relied upon FPL to:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">
<div>

</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In 2016, FPL provided the Compensation Committee updated information on compensation paid by and compensation structure of&#160;peer companies to their executive officers.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Peer Group Information</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In connection with its comprehensive review of the executive compensation arrangements for all of the Company&#8217;s executive officers, the Compensation Committee relied upon FPL to provide, among other things, compensation information and data regarding executive officers in the Company&#8217;s peer group.&#160; The peer group compensation information and data was one factor the Compensation Committee considered in establishing the Company&#8217;s executive compensation arrangements for 2016.&#160; The peer group consisted of 10 public company REITs in the hospitality industry and three public company REITs with similar market capitalization to the Company and with an overall median market capitalization of approximately $2.6 billion at the time of the report.&#160; The Company&#8217;s peer group consisted of the following public REITs:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company believes the peer group represents companies with which the Company competes for talent and business.&#160; The Compensation Committee used this peer group as follows: market data was obtained for the peer group companies to provide the Compensation Committee with a context in which to make base salary determinations and decisions regarding appropriate payout levels for incentive compensation for 2017.&#160; For 2015, total aggregate compensation for the named executive officers as a group was in the 40<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;FONT-SIZE: smaller; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">th</sup> percentile compared to compensation for the top five highest paid executives in the peer group companies for the prior year.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#160;At the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders, the Company provided shareholders with the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on 2015 executive compensation, and approximately </font>96<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">% of the shares voted on the &#8220;say-on-pay&#8221; proposal supported the compensation of the executive officers. The Compensation Committee viewed this advisory vote as an expression by the shareholders of their general satisfaction with the Company&#8217;s executive compensation program.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">32</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Elements of Executive Compensation</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Company&#8217;s executive compensation arrangements consist of base salary and incentive compensation.&#160; For 2016, the Compensation Committee considered both elements when setting annual base salary.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Annual Base Salary</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">Annual base salary is a fixed level of compensation that reflects each named executive officer&#8217;s position and individual performance.&#160; Base salary is designed to serve as a retention tool throughout the executive&#8217;s career.&#160; In determining base salaries, the Compensation Committee considered the salary information and data obtained for the executive officers in the peer group of companies identified above, each executive officer&#8217;s role and responsibility, unique skills, future potential with the Company, and internal pay equity considerations.&#160; After evaluating these factors, the Compensation Committee approved the following annual base salary of each named executive officer for 2016, which were the same as 2015 and will remain the same in 2017:</div>

</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Incentive Compensation</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The named executive officers are eligible to earn variable incentive compensation awards designed to reward the achievement of annual corporate and financial performance measures.&#160; For 2016, the Compensation Committee established target annual incentive award opportunities for each named executive officer, consisting of an annual cash bonus award and an additional equity compensation award opportunity, following an analysis of market information and data for executive officers in the peer group of companies identified above, each executive officer&#8217;s role and responsibility, unique skills, future potential with the Company, and other factors considered in determining base salary levels.&#160; The Compensation Committee considers all relevant facts and circumstances when evaluating performance, including changing market conditions and broad corporate strategic initiatives, along with overall responsibilities and contributions, and retains the ability to exercise its judgment and discretion to adjust an incentive compensation award.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">For 2016, the Compensation Committee established a target value of restricted shares to be awarded to each named executive officer as part of the 2016 target incentive compensation award opportunity, considering the same factors as those used for establishing the target annual cash bonus amounts.&#160; Approximately 75% of the target incentive compensation of the named executive officers was intended to be provided through equity awards and the remainder as an annual cash bonus.&#160; Any equity awards to be made upon the achievement of the performance goals would consist of (i) for the shareholder return metrics discussed below, one-half of the total award in restricted Common Shares that vest on December 15, 2017 and the remaining one half in fully vested Common Shares and (ii) for the operating metrics discussed below, one-half of the total award in fully vested Common Shares.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">2016 Incentive Compensation Award Opportunity</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">In 2016, each named executive officer was eligible to receive incentive compensation awards to be determined pursuant to a weighted average formula based on the achievement of certain performance measures.&#160;&#160;The amounts actually payable to the named executive officer were to be determined based upon whether Company performance met certain &#8220;threshold,&#8221; &#8220;target&#8221; or </div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">33</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#8220;maximum&#8221; levels for each of the performance measures.&#160;&#160;With respect to each performance measure, results below the threshold level result in a payment of 0% of the target value, results between the threshold and the target levels result in a payment of 50% to 100% of the target value, results between the target and the maximum levels result in a payment of 100% to 150% of the target value, and results above the maximum level result in a payment of 150% of the target value.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">At the time that they are set, the incentive goals that the Compensation Committee establishes are substantially uncertain to be achieved. The &#8220;threshold&#8221; level can be characterized as &#8220;stretch but attainable,&#8221; meaning that, although attainment is uncertain, based on historical performance, it can reasonably be anticipated that threshold performance may be achieved.&#160; The &#8220;target&#8221; and &#8220;maximum&#8221; levels represent increasingly challenging and aggressive levels of performance.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Compensation Committee established the following 2016 target values for the named executive officers.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table id="z5b71e27cd2154c9b8cbef6ae5b56fc64" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 75%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; WIDTH: 33%" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; WIDTH: 1%" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid" valign="bottom" colspan="2">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">2016 Target Cash </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Incentive </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Compensation </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Award </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Opportunity</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 1%" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; WIDTH: 1%" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Performance Measures</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">The Compensation Committee adopted performance goals for the 2016 incentive compensation awards following a review of the Company&#8217;s business plan and budget for the year.&#160; The Compensation Committee determined that the performance measures for 2016 should be based on objective goals, and the Compensation Committee did not set separate performance goals for individual executive officers.&#160; The incentive compensation awards for 2016 were based on the following operational and shareholder return performance goals:</div>

<div>
<table id="z3274fcd2a1654b4984847288a8f527b9" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Adjusted Hotel EBITDA margin growth &#8211; The Compensation Committee believes Adjusted Hotel EBITDA margin growth is a key metric of the Company&#8217;s operational performance and is used by management to measure the performance of the Company&#8217;s hotels and effectiveness of the operators of the hotels.&#160; Adjusted Hotel EBITDA margin growth is the year over year change in the Company&#8217;s adjusted earnings before interest, income taxes, depreciation and amortization, further adjusted to exclude actual corporate-level general and administrative expense as a percent of total revenue. The Compensation Committee established a goal for 2016 that ranged from an increase of 0.2% to 1.0%, weighted to account for 16.7% of the annual incentive compensation award opportunity.&#160; Adjusted Hotel EBITDA margin growth for 2016 was approximately (0.1%), therefore the threshold was not achieved.&#160; For this goal the Company calculates Adjusted Hotel EBITDA margin as (a) net income excluding (i) interest, income taxes and depreciation and amortization, (ii) transaction and litigation costs, gains or losses from sales of real estate and the loss on impairment of depreciable real estate assets as these do not represent ongoing operations, (iii) non-cash straight-line ground lease expense as this expense does not reflect the underlying performance of the related hotels and (iv) actual corporate-level general and administrative expense, divided by (b) total revenues.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="zb99c7a522ac24e7abb4a7999c7068bad" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Modified FFO per share &#8211; The Compensation Committee believes that modified funds from operations per share (&#8220;Modified FFO per share&#8221;) is a key metric in measuring the overall financial performance of the Company.&#160; The Compensation Committee established a goal for </div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font id="DSPFPageNumber" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">34</font></div>

<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div>
<table id="zb99c7a522ac24e7abb4a7999c7068bad" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">2016 that ranged from $1.65 to $1.95 per share, weighted to account for 16.7% of the annual incentive compensation award opportunity.&#160; Modified FFO per share for 2016 was $1.76.&#160; For this goal the Company used Modified FFO as defined in its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="zede70939cd4240f2a546c70fd7876979" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Comparable Hotels RevPAR growth &#8211; The Compensation Committee believes that comparable hotels revenue per available room growth (&#8220;Comparable Hotels RevPAR growth&#8221;) is a key metric in measuring growth of the Company.&#160; The Compensation Committee established a goal for 2016 that ranged from 3.75% to 6.75%, weighted to account for 16.7% of the annual incentive compensation award opportunity.&#160; Comparable Hotels RevPAR growth for 2016 was 2.7% and therefore the threshold was not achieved.&#160; For this goal the Company used Comparable Hotels revenue per available room, as defined in its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="zb34c624766d24698be986da967cd21ae" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Total shareholder return &#8211; The Compensation Committee believes that total shareholder return over a one year period is a key metric in measuring the benefit to shareholders of holding the Company&#8217;s shares over a period of time.&#160; The Compensation Committee established a goal for 2016 that ranged from 5.0% to 15.0%, weighted to account for 25% of the annual incentive compensation award opportunity, measured from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016. Total shareholder return for the measurement period in 2016 was approximately 6.2%.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div>
<table id="zc7e4bdb6d21f4c0ab301f2c433d7354c" class="DSPFListTable" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#183;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">Shareholder return relative to a peer group &#8211; The Compensation Committee believes that relative shareholder return compared to the Company&#8217;s peers is a key metric in measuring the benefit to shareholders of holding the Company&#8217;s shares relative to that of its peer companies.&#160; For this performance goal, the Company&#8217;s peer group consisted of Chatham Lodging Trust, Hersha Hospitality Trust, RLJ Lodging Trust, Ashford Hospitality Trust, Inc. and Summit Hotel Properties, Inc. The Compensation Committee established a goal for 2016 that ranged from 0% to 10%, weighted to account for 25% of the annual incentive compensation award opportunity, measured from January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2016. Change in shareholder return relative to the peer group for the measurement period in 2016 was approximately (13.8%) and therefore the threshold was not achieved.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">2016 Incentive Compensation Award Amounts</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt">For 2016, the Company&#8217;s performance was below the threshold level of Adjusted Hotel EBITDA margin growth, above the threshold level of Modified FFO per share, below the threshold level of Comparable Hotels RevPAR growth, slightly above the threshold level of total shareholder return and below the threshold for shareholder return relative to a peer group. The Compensation Committee did not make any adjustments to the incentive compensation payable to the named executive officers based on the achievement of the various performance goals.&#160; The incentive compensation awards for 2016 were approximately 30% of target incentive compensation and were as follows:</div>

<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>
